page.title: 11DEER RESEARCH,RHUM_AIMS
page.content: {Kilmory Glen}is the centre of a long term study of red deer.Island deer are culled annually but in 1972 culling in here stopped.The population has almost doubled making it possible to investi_ gate effects population density has on the breeding success of the deer & on their feeding & social behaviour & the indentification of causes of variation in the breeding success between each deer. Recognition of individual deer is essential. Natural variations in facial characteristics & coat markings are used & many are caught & marked with coloured ear tags & collars.Their capture also provides an opportunity to collect weights, measurements & blood samples.Information is collected by detailed observation of behaviour & regular censuses. Censuses taken over the rest of Rhum allow comparisons of low population with this high density.
